module.name: property_condition
module.keywords: module, property, physical quantity, class, possession, characterisation, necessary condition

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the possession of a property by each member of a class of product or activity. Possession of the property is a necessary condition for membership of the class.
A necessary condition can be deemed by a design activity or predicted by an analysis activity.

example.p: Each member of widget type XYZ has an unloaded widget length between 9.9 m and 10.1 m. Hence, having an unloaded widget length in this range is a necessary condition for membership of the class widget type XYZ.
This statement makes use of the following concepts:

ul.li: 'widget type XYZ', which is a class of product;
length range 9.9 m to 10.1 m, which is a physical quantity range; and
the 'unloaded widgth length' possession of property relationship between the class 'widget' and length;
the condition relationship between between the class 'widget type XYZ' and the length range 9.9 m to 10.1 m.

example.p: The condition relationship can be defined by this application module. The condition relationship can be classified as a subclass of the 'unloaded widget length' possession of property relationship.

li.p: a necessary property condition for membership of a class of product;
a necessary property condition for membership of a class of activity.
the sufficient conditions for membership of a class of product or activity;
the specification of a physical quantity range;

note.p: A physical quantity range is within the scope of the Property_space application module.

li.p: the nature of a possession of property relationship;

note.p: The relationship between a vessel and a pressure can be classified as a 'maximum operating pressure' relationship or a 'hydrostatic test pressure' relationship. The class of possessioin of property is within the scope of the Property_space application module.

li.p: a possession of a physical quantity instance by an individual product or indvidual activity;

note.p: A possession of a physical quantity instance by an individual product or indvidual activity is within the scope of the Possession_of_property application module.

li.p: the specification of a physical quantity instance;

note.p: A physical quantity instance is within the scope of the Independent_property_definition application module.

li.p: the identification of a physical quantity instance with respect to a unit of measure.

note.p: The identification of a physical quantity instance with respect to a unit of measure is within the scope of the Property_identification application module.

uof.name: Property_condition
uof.description: The Property_condition UoF specifies that each member of a class of product or activity and a class possesses a physical quantity instance within a prescribed range. Possession of the property is a necessary condition for membership of the class of product or activity.
